$comment: MCP Server Configuration for Local LLM Research Analytics Tool

mssql.description: Microsoft SQL Server MCP Server for database operations

mssql_tools.list_tables: Lists all tables in the connected database
mssql_tools.describe_table: Get schema information for a specific table
mssql_tools.read_data: Query and retrieve data from tables
mssql_tools.insert_data: Insert new rows into tables (batch supported)

authentication_types.sql: SQL Server authentication with username and password
authentication_types.windows: Windows integrated authentication (uses current Windows credentials)
authentication_types.azure_ad_interactive: Azure AD with interactive browser login

environment_variables.MCP_MSSQL_PATH: Full path to the MSSQL MCP Server index.js file
environment_variables.SQL_DATABASE_NAME: Name of the database to connect to
environment_variables.SQL_AUTH_TYPE: Authentication type: sql, windows, azure_ad_interactive, azure_ad_default
environment_variables.SQL_USERNAME: SQL Server username (required for sql auth type)
environment_variables.SQL_PASSWORD: SQL Server password (required for sql auth type)
environment_variables.SQL_ENCRYPT: Set to 'true' to encrypt connection (required for Azure)
environment_variables.MCP_MSSQL_READONLY: Set to 'true' to disable write operations

setup_instructions: 1. Clone the MSSQL MCP Server repository:
4. Set MCP_MSSQL_PATH to the dist/index.js location
5. Configure SQL Server connection in .env file
6. Set SQL_AUTH_TYPE=sql for SQL Server authentication
